content:
I didn't know that we could add modules and themes to our PR sandboxes in Github.

I know now.

Yes. The fact the until recently we could not do that with the tugboat sandboxes is why I have been maintaining https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/2206 ...and https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/1831 before that :sweat_smile:

Please ignore this by klonos · Pull Request #2206 · backdrop/backdrop
...using this PR as a sandbox generator.
Please ignore this by klonos · Pull Request #1831 · backdrop/backdrop
Just need a PR sandbox. Sorry for polluting the PR queue.
^^ these are both "empty" PRs (just a single dot added in the README) ...which was my cheeky way of keeping temporary sandboxes around, in the pre-tugboat era.
GitHub is a bit flaky https://www.githubstatus.com
I just got an update for Git on my computer. Maybe it was related... (i.e. GitHub updating stuff)?

This has been announced for some time now: https://github.blog/changelog/2020-04-21-code-navigation-is-now-available-for-all-javascript-php-and-typescript-repositories/

Code navigation is now available for all JavaScript, PHP, and TypeScript repositories
Code navigation is now available for all JavaScript, PHP, and TypeScript repositories
...but it doesn't work on our repo. Does anyone have any idea if we need to do something on our end?
I believe that it only works with .php files.
Not 100% sure though

JS works: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.x/core/misc/autocomplete.js#L208

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

Interesting: https://github.blog/changelog/2020-05-11-account-successors

Account successors
Account successors
Oooh! Just discovered dark mode in GitHub: image.png

I just switched to the dark side too (relax, not switching to D8/9 :smiling_imp: ) ...takes some getting used to. Especially the code diff in the PRs, but hey, we need to save the environment, and our eyes :smile:
I find it very neon :smile: But slowly getting used to it.
The animation when switching is sooo cute.

Hello, @docwilmot and myself are having access issues for the search_api_db repo. He's trying to add me as the maintainer.
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/search_api_db/pull/3
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/search_api_db/issues/2
Thanks in advance...

Add earlyburg as a maintainer by earlyburg · Pull Request #3 · backdrop-contrib/search_api_db
#2 @docwilmot Hello I'm just making this official.
Request to become a maintainer. · Issue #2 · backdrop-contrib/search_api_db
Hello @docwilmot, I respectfully request that I be added as a maintainer of this module, and be given adequate permissions to update the repo as necessary. I thank you. Happy Holidays!
@klonos
All done @earlyburg and @docwilmot :+1:
Many Thanks @klonos

@jenlampton @quicksketch We have separated our code repo (https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop) from our issue repo (https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues) for reasons I can't recall. Are those reasons still valid, or is it time to start considering merging them both into one repo...?

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.
backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

My understanding is that we have different repos, because of permissions. It was my understanding that permissions in the issue queue are tied to permissions for the repo and we would either have to be very conservative in granting permission for managing issues or be very liberal in granting access to the code.

I think that was the original reason for two different repos. I don't know if Github has made it easier for us to accommodate both.

It is easier to manage now than it was before, but it's still not ideal. The main reason for not combining now is that we'd have a problem with issue numbers (since PRs are issues too) we'd have conflicts merging the two repos.
I think if we're going to declare PR bankruptcy and close/delete them all, we should do that at a nice clean milestone, like 2.x.

Interesting reading. Finally got why two repоs.

jenlampton said:

It is easier to manage now than it was before, but it's still not ideal. The main reason for not combining now is that we'd have a problem with issue numbers (since PRs are issues too) we'd have conflicts merging the two repos.

@jenlampton , do you think this solution https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1425892/how-do-you-merge-two-git-repositories could mitigate the issue somehow?

How do you merge two Git repositories?
Consider the following scenario: I have developed a small experimental project A in its own Git repo. It has now matured, and I'd like A to be part of larger project B, which has its own big repos...
Sounds like that's specific to keeping git commit history, whereas our main problem is merging GitHub functionality - issues and PRs...
yeah. We'd also need to remove the "code" from the issues repo, but we could move that to ops pretty easily
the problem is that there are issues with the same issue number as PRs for core
and the only way to solve that is to sacrifice all the PRs, and overwrite them with the issues.
Wonder if there's a way to automatically create PRs in the issues repo (with new IDs), linking to the same issue as before...
I've submitted a ticket to GitHub asking about the possibility of merging the repos, to see if it's possible and how we might go about it.

We had a previous conversation similar to this at https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4041

How can we use the new GitHub "triage" role for managing issues? · Issue #4041 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Back in May 2019, GitHub introduced a new feature for a "Triage" role that allows users to add and remove tags, milestones, and assignees but without the permission to push to the reposit...

Just opened a GitHub link in a different browser profile than I normally use (so I'm logged out), and the lack of dark mode startled me for a moment. Everything looks so bright and white! My eyes! :laughing:
I just noticed this: image.png
...wondering how you can "resolve" comments :thinking: ...I really like that feature in PR comments, but cannot see how it would work in issues(?)
I can't see this. Do you have 'beta' access or something @klonos ?

Right :face_palm: ...I keep forgetting that. ...not beta access, but https://github.com/sindresorhus/refined-github

sindresorhus/refined-github
:octocat: Browser extension that simplifies the GitHub interface and adds useful features - sindresorhus/refined-github

...it was added as a `conversation activity filter" feature in a recent release, about 9 days ago: https://github.com/sindresorhus/refined-github/pull/4029

Add `conversation-activity-filter` feature by fregante · Pull Request #4029 · sindresorhus/refined-github
Closes #3764 Closes #615 Replaces #3847 Screenshot (readme screenshot wip) Test Every event is on #4030 Some events are on #3847 but you can also test the native "X event hidden" there...
It's interesting to be used to Backdrop's ways of using GitHub, then see how other projects do things. I just witnessed an issue being closed in favour of a PR... :shrug:

Ooooh! ...even moar features on GitHub:
image.png
image.png
image.png
image.png
Whats going on with notifications? Why do I have 80+ GH notifications in my email about subscribing to CI User?

I'm not sure about the "subscribing to CI User" bit, but I got a bunch of notifications in GitHub too right after I rebased a PR. I think it was because I originally made the PR branch in the core repo (as opposed to my own fork), so maybe that triggered it...? If so, sorry, my bad.

I got 10 emails from BackdropCMS CI User (55 minutes ago). Maybe @docwilmot got more, because he is involved in more issues.

Most of these emails say I received them, because i was mentioned in the issue.
yes, my mistake, theyre all just about backdrop-ci making new comments.

Is anyone else having weird issues with Github today. If I go here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues

I can not see the menu link to the issue queue as per usual. If I follow a direct link to the issue queue, I am able to access it and navigate around. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Looks fine to me on mobile...
OK, when I login as Triplo (my business account) it work as expected. This is only effecting my personal account. I might have changed some setting somewhere, but I don't understand what I did.
Seem like I just had to clear my browser cache. I don't understand how this happened, but I've cleared it up.
Same thing with my account @StPaulTim
...this is what I see: image.png
image.png
...the top navigation is either gone, or messed up :shrug:
...not only the Backdrop repo ...other repos as well (both private and public)
...happens on multiple browsers, and in incognito mode too.
That is exactly what I saw, except if I logged in on another browser it was fine. I cleared my cache and it was all fine.

These weird notifications are still happening. I;m getting a bunch of You are receiving this because you were mentioned. emails often, for issues long past, without anyone having recently commented or pushed.

Got this one today: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-composer/commit/7966fb71cef191a0c82d10426b56d19050a68b70

Issue #4555: Change 'wildcard' to 'placeholder' on Layout Add form, a… · backdrop-ops/backdrop-composer@7966fb7
…nd add exmaples of core paths. By @jenlampton, @stpaultim, @klonos & @docwilmot.
Not even a recent issue. And composer?

It's because it was updated to 1.18.2: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdrop-composer/commit/144a550f573876e29e07052d6b6dbd568b6b0f7d

Update to Backdrop 1.18.2 · backdrop-ops/backdrop-composer@144a550
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop-ops/backdrop-composer development by creating an account on GitHub.

I've previously asked about alternative ways of updating these extra repos, to avoid all the notifications, but they wanted them to have a history of all commits, so we have to put up with this notification influx every update...
